result.execSummary:
The defendant Scott G Schalow was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Scott G Schalow

records.addlTxt:
10:59 AM 
Clerk Micki.

State appears by ADA Hannah Boeck; Defendant appears in person, pro se.

Date and time set for JPTC/TPD. 

ADA Boeck states a resolution has been reached.
COURT addresses Defendant.
Defendant wishes to proceed without counsel.

COURT advises defendant of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & questions defendant to understanding.

PLEA to: 
COUNT 1: Disorderly Conduct >> NO CONTEST.

COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & voluntary made, defendant is competent to represent self a factual basis & defendant guilty.

COURT ORDERS: $100.00 fine; CC; and DNA sample and surcharge. 

Adj: 11:09 a.m.

BOTR: 11:09a.m.
Defendant can make a $100.00 payment today and then set up payment plan.

ADJ: 11:10a.m.

ADA Hannah Boeck appears in person; Defendant appears in person; pro se
DATES: Keep dates on as scheduled

No contact with victim(s): AmericInn in Wausau; Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney. No Bars, Taverns, Liquor Stores, or Beer Tents. Absolute sobriety from and no possession of alcohol/controlled substances except prescriptions taken as prescribed. Prints and photograph.

Clerk: Nikki. 
Case Called: 3:37pm.
State appears by ADA Hannah Boeck. Defendant appears in person, pro se.
VCRW.
Reading Waived. Reserve Jurisdiction.
Court questions defendant re: complaint and rights.
Advised Right of Counsel.
PLEA: NOT GUILTY by COURT.

COURT QUASHES WARRANT.

COURT ORDERS BOND:
$250.00 signature.

CONDITIONS:
-No contact with victim(s): AmericInn in Wausau
-No Bars, Taverns, Liquor Stores, or Beer Tents.
-Absolute sobriety from and no possession of alcohol/controlled substances except prescriptions taken as prescribed.
-Prints and photograph.

DATES:
PTC w/JA: 6/14 @11:00am. 
JPTC: 7/21 @11:00am. 
JSH: 8/23 @11:30am. 
JT: 9/14 @9:00am. 

Adjourned: 3:40pm.

Clerk: Nikki.
Case Called: 3:24pm.
State appears by Hannah Boeck. Defendant FAILS to appear.
Date and time set for an Initial Appearance/Voluntary Appearance. VRCW.
COURT AUTHORIZES BW$500.00.

Adjourned: 3:25pm.
